result.execSummary:
The defendant Billy Joe Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution. (Bond on file applied - balance still due).

If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

In the event it becomes necessary, Defendant will receive Jail credit of 2 days.
Pay restitution in the amount of $910.83, referenced in the restitution summary.
Do not maintain or open a checking account in any financial institution; do not possess or issue or negotiate any checks at any financial institution.
Comply with all requirements established by the agent.
Remain diligent in repaying, efforts in repaying restitution order.
Maintain employment during period of probation.
Eligible for early discharge if conditions of probation are met and recommended by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Billy Joe Davis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Billy Joe Davis in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:01 AM Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

Matter is listed as a plea and sentencing.

Court has a Plea questionnaire/Agreement signed by Defendant as well as a restitution summary.

There is an agreement.
Defendant will enter a plea to Count 1 and Count 2 and Count 3.
Count 4 and Count 5 will be dismissed and read in.

Atty Zamzow concurs.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 3

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Zamzow for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Found Guilty
Count 2: Found Guilty
Count 3: Found Guilty
Count 4: Dismissed and Read In
Count 5: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Zamzow makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court believes the joint recommendation is appropriate, particularly the length of the probation period.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period for 24 Months
In the event it becomes necessary, Defendant will receive Jail credit of 2 days
Conditions:
Pay restitution in the amount of $910.83, referenced in the restitution summary
Pay costs
Pay warrant fee of $30
Do not maintain or open a checking account in any financial institution; do not possess or issue or negotiate any checks at any financial institution
Comply with all requirements established by the agent
Remain diligent in repaying, efforts in repaying restitution order
Maintain employment during period of probation
Eligible for early discharge if conditions of probation are met and recommended by the agent

Count 2:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period for 24 Months concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1
Pay costs

Count 3:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period for 24 Months concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 and Count 2
Pay costs

Cash bond of $200 is to be applied to restitution.

1:50 p.m. Defendant Billy Joe Davis in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/NG entered.
Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Prior: 3440 North Evergreen Drive, Apt 3, Plover, WI 54467 United States

cash bond $200 - No contact with Cooper Oil or BP stations in Stevens Point.

Defendant Billy Joe Davis in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:18 p.m. case is called.
This is a return on warrant.
ADA states the defendant missed an initial appearance.  Warrant was authorized with $940.83 cash alternative 
Address:  3340 N. Evergreen Drive, Apt. 3, Plover, WI 54467
The defendant is disabled.
The court indicates there is a alternative cash bond of $940.83
The defendant's attorney is Jean Zamzow
The court calls the defendant's attorney.  
Defense attorney indicates the defendant was in custody in Waushara County as the reason for the failure to appear.
Defense attorney requests a signature bond 
ADA Constable is hesitant to a signature bond as his previous address was Redgranite, WI.  
Defense attorney replies.  
ADA makes additional statement as to the bond.  Requests a cash bond to insure future court appearances and recommends $200 cash bond
Court questions re: employment as condition of probation.  
Defense attorney responds to the court.  

Court will reduce cash bond amount
Quash the warrant
cash bond $200 - no contact with Cooper Oil or BP stations in Stevens Point.  Initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Billy Joe Davis not in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:47 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Constable notes affidavit of mailing is in the file. 

BY THE COURT:  Court finds complaint shows probable cause.  Criminal warrant with a $940.83 cash alternative.
